items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: ‘Psycho killer’ Parmar shot dead during crime scene reconstruction in Ahmedabad
items.summary: Parmar allegedly snatched a firearm from a patrol team personnel and opened fire while attempting to escape. The police retaliated, leading to his death on spot, says DGP Vikas Sahay

items.title: Sivaganga custodial death case: CBI gets six weeks to complete probe into custodial death case
items.summary: A Division Bench of Justices Anita Sumanth and C. Kumarappan also directed the CBI to complete the probe into the alleged theft of jewellery linked to the case, and file the final report in both cases.

items.summary: Israel does not allow foreign journalists into Gaza independently, citing security grounds.

items.title: It's got Peaky Blinders swagger, says House of Guinness writer
items.summary: The new Netflix drama tells the story of Ireland's most famous family name at the moment of crisis.

items.summary: Sources said Mr. Ahluwalia maintained there was no evidence to show simultaneous elections would increase GDP by 1.5%; Mr. Panagariya and Surjit S. Bhalla concurred with report of High-Level Committee

items.title: Man arrested in U.K. over alleged cyberattack that affected European airports
items.summary: The U.K.'s National Crime Agency said the suspect was held in West Sussex on September 23 on suspicion of offenses involving the misuse of computers and was released on conditional bail.

items.title: Labubu dolls made up 90% of fake toys seized at UK border
items.summary: Of the 259,000 fake toys seized in 2025, 236,000 were counterfeit Labubus, the Home Office says.

items.title: 'She doesn't get another childhood': The lives on hold waiting for wheelchairs
items.summary: More than a thousand disabled children are waiting for wheelchairs and equipment that could transform their lives, Whizz Kidz say

items.title: UK drug price rises 'necessary', says Patrick Vallance
items.summary: His comments come after pharmaceutical giants either paused or scrapped projects in the UK.

items.title: Why 'Wood has to watch his back' as Igor Jesus shines
items.summary: Are Chris Wood's days as a permanent starter at Nottingham Forest over after Igor Jesus scores two on the club's return to the European stage.

items.title: Dasara celebrations: Rain likely to play spoilsport in Vijayawada
items.summary: Heavy to very heavy rainfall expected in the city on September 26 and 27; IMD predicts heavy rain forecast for the State, thanks to a fresh low-pressure area that is likely to form on September 25

items.title: Supreme Court urged to fill up nearly 5000 vacancies in district courts
items.summary: Petitions to the top court call for an ‘integrated’ approach to filling up the over 5,000 vacancies in district courts

items.summary: European Ryder Cup captain Luke Donald says his team are "fuelled by something money can’t buy" in what appears to be a dig at their American rivals.

items.title: Labour MPs are privately urging me to challenge PM, says Burnham
items.summary: Andy Burnham tells the Telegraph MPs have privately urged him to challenge Sir Keir Starmer to be PM.

items.title: 'I'm done being quiet' - Naz condemns racist abuse
items.summary: Tottenham condemn racist abuse received by forward Jessica Naz on social media after she posts about messages sent to her.

items.title: 'Anti-ICE' message on ammunition at Dallas shooting that killed immigration detainee
items.summary: The gunman fired at an unmarked van near the detention facility, before taking his own life, officials say.

items.title: Crews attend 'serious explosion' at warehouse
items.summary: People are being evacuated from an industrial estate following a "serious" explosion.

items.title: Watch: White House replaces President Biden portrait with image of an autopen
items.summary: President Donald Trump has previously claimed Biden used an autopen to sign important documents, including pardons.

items.title: 'A cool scene' - but will Bethpage's first tee intimidate Europe?
items.summary: Will a first-tee stand that looks more "London Stadium than Upton Park" provide an intimidatory advantage for America's players at Bethpage Black?

items.title: 'I'd be dead without Coleen' - Rooney
items.summary: Former England captain Wayne Rooney says he could have died had his wife Coleen not been there to help him manage problems with alcohol.

items.title: China makes landmark pledge to cut its climate emissions
items.summary: It is China's first firm goal to reduce emissions but falls well short of what is needed to meet global targets.

items.title: High-speed rail plan for north of England delayed again
items.summary: The BBC understands the prime minister will now not announce plans for a rail link between Manchester and Liverpool at the Labour Party conference.

items.title: First migrants arrive in UK from France under 'one in one out' deal
items.summary: A family of three are the first people to be allowed into the country from France, the Home Office says.

items.title: Russia will expand aggression beyond Ukraine if not stopped, Zelensky warns
items.summary: Vladimir Putin "will keep driving the war forward wider and deeper", the Ukrainian president tells the UN.

items.title: Urgent review ordered into asylum seeker taxi costs after BBC investigation
items.summary: Asylum seekers are travelling long distances for appointments, with one telling the BBC his journey to visit a GP cost the Home Office £600.

items.title: Meet the history-making Nasa astronauts headed for the Moon next year
items.summary: Astronauts of Nasa's first crewed mission to the Moon for more than 50 years hope their journey inspires a new generation.

items.title: Israeli forces near Gaza City centre as Hamas reportedly prepares for street-to-street fighting
items.summary: Thousands of Palestinians have been forced to flee Gaza City since Israel launched its ground offensive last week.

items.title: Steve Rosenberg: Russia brushes off Trump's claim of 'paper tiger' in aimless war
items.summary: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg says far from being riled by Trump's comments, Russia's response has so far been restrained.

items.title: Huntington's disease successfully treated for first time
items.summary: One of the most devastating diseases finally has a treatment that can slow its progression and transform lives, tearful doctors tell BBC.

items.title: Vallabha Agraharam Street awaits civic upgrades amid daily hustle

items.title: Will AI help fix India’s energy demand or will its own needs surge?
items.summary: A McKinsey report has estimated that the annual global demand for data centre capacity could rise at 19-22% from 2023 to 2030, reaching 171-219 GW, against the total current demand of 60 GW. To avoid a deficit, at least twice as much data centre capacity built since 2000 will have to be in place in

items.title: We love India, want more energy trade with it: U.S. Energy Secretary
items.summary: We want to expand our energy cooperation with India in natural gas and coal, in nuclear, in clean cooking fuels, liquid petroleum gas, India has been a star in that area. So we want nothing more than more trade, energy cooperation with India, says U.S. Energy Secretary Chris Wright

items.title: Israel says conclusion of talks with Syria contingent on demilitarisation, safeguarding Druze
items.summary: Under U.S. pressure, Syria is accelerating talks with Israel for a security pact that Damascus hopes will reverse Israel's recent seizures of its land but that would fall far short of a full peace treaty

items.title: Former President Mutharika wins Malawi election to oust longtime rival Chakwera
items.summary: The 85-year-old Mr. Mutharika, who was President from 2014-2020, won 56% of the vote, according to the Malawi Electoral Commission. Mr. Chakwera was second with 33%

items.title: Typhoon Ragasa slams into south China after killing 14 in Taiwan
items.summary: The typhoon had hours earlier swept past Hong Kong, with the densely populated city's weather service ranking the storm the strongest yet in the northwestern Pacific this year

items.title: Strike on market in Sudan's El-Fasher kills 15 people
items.summary: The RSF is currently waging its fiercest assault yet in an attempt to seize El-Fasher, which it has besieged since May last year.

items.title: 1 detainee killed and 2 others critically injured in Dallas ICE facility, Homeland Security says
items.summary: The suspect has been identified by a law enforcement official as 29-year-old Joshua Jahn. The official could not publicly disclose details of the investigation and spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity

items.title: Jaishankar hosts FIPIC Foreign Ministers' meeting in New York
